readability_reflection: String concatenation personally helped me more. I have worked more with concatenation.
comprehension_debugging: String interpolation, to me, crowded the code snippets much more and made them a little harder to read.
preference_rationale: I would without a doubt use string concatenation. As i said before, in my experience coding, i have used concatenation more and that format makes more sense to me.
learning_curve: Having taken 3 coding classes at UNLV, I have a lot of experience with string concatenation. I have used it in numerous programming assignments, as well as personal projects. It is much easier to read for me. Interpolation tends to cloud up the screen with the extraneous "{}" so it got a little hard to follow what needed to go where.
suggestions_improvement: As of now, concatenation is not hard to read whatsoever. For interpolation, when multiple brackets get involved, it tends to get a little crowded so finding someway to eliminate the need of all of those brackets would make it less crowded and easier to read.
